adjectives.description: nontrivial (comparative more nontrivial, superlative most nontrivial)

entries.meaning: (mathematics) Not obvious or easy to prove; not self-evident.
(mathematics) Not being of the simplest kind; not being empty or a singleton.
examples: nontrivial subgroup ― a subgroup with more than one element

entries.meaning: (computing) Needing significant computing power to solve; intractable.
